rename.from: Streamlit startup time could be reduced from 1s to 600ms
rename.to: Streamlit startup time could be reduced from 1s to 400ms

body: Thanks for analyzing this! Some time ago I opened enhancement request #5798 with the same goal in mind (reduce startup time) but mostly focused on the size and quantity of Streamlit core static files. Sharing here because looking at both (python imports and static files) might be worthwhile.

Thanks for the investigation üëç  I did a quick check. I think besides the Plotly theme, all other proposed changes are viable. 

As far as I remember, in order to apply our Streamlit chart theme in the frontend we need to apply changes to the global Plotly theme before any chart object is created (fyi @willhuang1997).

Regarding Altair theme: removing it might break a few apps (that's why we kept it in), but it was never an official feature anyways. So, I assume this isn't a problem.
We can always do this in parts: first the easy ones, then the themes (if possible).

issue.title: Add implementation of Snowpark connection

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
Note: This PR is targeting the `vdonato/sql-connection` branch for now so that the diff looks nicer.
We'll retarget it to `feature/st.experimental_connection` once the other branch is merged.

## üìö Context

This PR adds an implementation of another first party connection class: the `Snowpark` connection.
This connection is a thin wrapper around the `snowflake-snowpark-python` library to make it play nicely
with the `st.experimental_connection` factory function. It also implements locking around operations with
the underlying library so that the app author doesn't have to think of thread safety.

Similarly to with our `SQL` connector, there's still a bit of work to do for this one:
* Retries for the `read_sql` method still need to be implemented.
* We need to add some unit tests for the class itself. This will be done in a later PR.

issue.title: Improve startup performance by lazy loading some dependencies

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## üìö Context

This implements some of the suggestions from https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/6066 to improve the startup performance of Streamlit:

1. Move Styler imports to function-level
2. Move requests imports to function-level
5. Move validators library to function-level

- What kind of change does this PR introduce?

  - [ ] Bugfix
  - [ ] Feature
  - [x] Refactoring
  - [ ] Other, please describe:

---

**Contribution License Agreement**

By submitting this pull request you agree that all contributions to this project are made under the Apache 2.0 license.

body: Update: the altair dependency was moved into lazy loading in this PR: https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/6618 and pandas styler, validator, and requests here: https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/6531. This will be part of the `1.23` release giving us a small boost in startup performance.

  - use a bash script to run `python -X importtime -c 'import streamlit' 2> latency.log` X times. X was 10000 in this case. 
  - use a python script to calculate the average times which ended up being with the current changes:
    - ** IN PROGRESS **
  - the current time with develop: 
    - ** IN PROGRESS **

issue.title: Lazy-load emoji module to improve performance

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes

The emoji data is the biggest object when running a blank Streamlit app. Compiling the regex is also slightly expensive. However, the emoji data is only required if there is a check for emojis; many apps might not require this. Therefore, this PR makes the emoji module to lazy load only if it is actually required.  

This also adds a precheck for emoji checks to make sure that the string even contains non alphanumeric characters before using the more expensive emoji regex. 

## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)

Related to https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/6066

## Testing Plan

- Added e2e test to check that some lazy-loaded modules are not imported in an almost blank Streamlit app.

---

**Contribution License Agreement**

By submitting this pull request you agree that all contributions to this project are made under the Apache 2.0 license.

issue.title: Lazy-load the watchdog event watcher module

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes

If a user configures `server.fileWatcherType` to none or poll, there isn't any reason we need to import the watchdog package, even if it is installed on the system. This PR applies a couple of small refactorings to make the `event_based_path_watcher` lazy-loaded (only importer if actually needed). 

## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)

Related to #6066

## Testing Plan

- Added e2e test to make sure that `watchdog` and `streamlit.watcher.event_based_path_watcher` are lazy loaded.

---

**Contribution License Agreement**

By submitting this pull request you agree that all contributions to this project are made under the Apache 2.0 license.

issue.title: Refactor plotly theme creation

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes

A small refactoring related to the creation of the plotly theme. Instead of using a module for the plotly theme, we are capturing the creation in a method to make it slightly better behave to enable lazy-loading for plotly.  

There aren't any other logical changes in here related to the Plotly theme.

This refactor also applies a couple of other small refactorings related to the imports.

Related to #6066

---

**Contribution License Agreement**

By submitting this pull request you agree that all contributions to this project are made under the Apache 2.0 license.

issue.title: Use env variable to configure matplotlib backend

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes

The deprecation of the `runner.fixMatplotlib` and the decision to always use the `Agg` backend, made it possible to just configure the matplotlib backend via the config option (also see the previous TODO comment). This prevents an unnecessary import of matplotlib at the server start and allows to lazy load this import.

## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)

Related to #6066

## Testing Plan

- Added unit and e2e tests to make sure that `matplotlib` is properly lazy-loaded.

---

**Contribution License Agreement**

By submitting this pull request you agree that all contributions to this project are made under the Apache 2.0 license.

issue.title: Lazy-load vendored pympler asizeof module

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes

The vendored pympler module is only used when someone explicitly requests the metrics via the metrics endpoint. This PR moves the module to lazyloading. 

## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)

Related to #6066

## Testing Plan

- Added e2e test to ensure that vendored `pympler` module is lazy loaded.
---

issue.title: Lazy-load pandas and pyarrow to improve performance

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes

Lazy-load `pandas` and `pyarrow` only when required (e.g. usage of `st.dataframe`).

This PR also includes a couple of other small refactorings related to typing and imports.

## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)

Related to #6066

## Testing Plan

issue.title: Remove `dateutil` and `tzlocal` dependencies

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes

This PR removes `dateutil` dependency by replicating the required method. And removes the `tzlocal` dependency, which isn't used within Streamlit for anything. It's only used within one test. So its added as test-dependency instead.

Related to #6066

---

**Contribution License Agreement**

By submitting this pull request you agree that all contributions to this project are made under the Apache 2.0 license.

issue.title: Remove importlib-metadata dependency

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes

The `importlib-metadata` is a backport to bring some of the `importlib.metadata` functionality to pre Python 3.7. But we don't support Python 3.7 anymore, so we can just remove this dependency.

Related to #6066

---

**Contribution License Agreement**

By submitting this pull request you agree that all contributions to this project are made under the Apache 2.0 license.

issue.title: Fix issue using a local path with `st.image` on windows.

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes

This PR fixes an issue with using image files via a local path on Windows (https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/7271). This also unifies all URL checks in the Streamlit server with a Python native implementation and cuts out the `validators` dependency. 

## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)

- Closes #7271
- Related to #6066

## Testing Plan

- Updated tests

---

**Contribution License Agreement**

By submitting this pull request you agree that all contributions to this project are made under the Apache 2.0 license.

body: Removed a couple of dependencies: - https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/8097 - https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/8094 - https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/8092 (validators) And lazy-loaded a couple of other modules: - https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/8109 - https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/8124 - https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/8111 - https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/8125 - https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/8134 - https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/8113 - https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/8105 This allows to reduce the import time to as low as ~200ms: And will enable significant speed ups related to the loading time of [stlite](https://github.com/whitphx/stlite) ü•≥ We also now have an e2e test to make sure that we don't accidentally import any of the lazy-loaded packages.

issue.title: Refactor typing and imports

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes

- Updates all the old type annotation aspects with the future versions by using: `pyupgrade --py38-plus  ...`
- Add types to a couple of untyped methods.
- Move all imports from `typing_extensions` to `typing` that are available with Python >= 3.8.
- Remove a couple of unused variables.
- Unify all logger uses to `_LOGGER: Final = get_logger(__name__)`

## Testing Plan

- This isn't supposed to affect any logic. So, it doesn't need any tests.

---

**Contribution License Agreement**

By submitting this pull request you agree that all contributions to this project are made under the Apache 2.0 license.
